  • About

    About

    Who am I?

    I’m a gameplay programmer focused on Unreal Engine and C++, but I’m not limited to them. I enjoy learning new languages, exploring low-level systems, and improving my understanding of how things work under the hood.

    Why Game Industry

    I love games that leave a lasting impression through their gameplay, stories, and art. I want to contribute to creating more experiences like that.

    Education

    Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Engineering
    İzmir Institute of Technology
    2018 – 2024

    Work Experience

    Gameplay & AI Programmer
    Tekden Studio
    2024 – 2025

    • Built core combat systems including targeting, switching, blocking, parrying, and player attacks for an action story game.
    • Developed offensive combat mechanics with a custom input buffering system, removing timing inconsistencies and improving player control.
    • Suggested and implemented new attack types for the player character, creating flexible attack logic with data-driven parameters for dodgable, blockable, parryable, and interruptible actions, allowing designers to tune behavior easily and improving combat clarity and predictability.
    • Debugged and refactored state machine edge cases and desync issues to improve system stability.
    • Designed traversal and progression gate systems, integrating environment challenges efficiently.
    • Created modular data assets for NPC combat, animations, sound effects, and factions. Implemented RNG driven visual variation to increase NPC diversity.
    • Contributed to scalable spawning systems using structured data and asynchronous loading for stable performance during large encounters.
    • Built dynamic AI detection and modular behaviors for patrol, investigation, and combat as reusable components, allowing easy application or removal on NPCs and full tuning by designers.
    • Integrated Group Actor and Token systems for coordinated encounters while maintaining stable performance.
    • Used Gameplay Ability System extensively for modular combat and AI logic.
    • Created all Gameplay Cue Notifies in the project to improve combat feedback and timing clarity.
    • Collaborated with gameplay, AI, quest, and UI developers, as well as artists and designers, in an agile workflow, taking responsibility for iterating rapidly on combat, AI, and gameplay systems based on design feedback and playtesting to ensure features were intuitive, responsive, and contributed positively to the player experience.

    Gameplay Programmer Intern
    Stratera Games 2022 – 2022

    • Developed a 2D spaceship game individually in Unity C#, sharing progress and receiving feedback during supervised team meetings with a senior developer.
    • Used GitHub for version control, managing commits, code reviews, and coordination with other interns.
    • Participated in a studio game jam with a team of three interns, creating a playable prototype under tight deadlines and contributing to gameplay implementation and debugging.
    • Playtested an upcoming studio title before release, identifying bugs, providing clear reproduction steps, and helping improve stability and user experience.
